1892.

718248f.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake ; Bow Bridge.
718248f.text:
Central Park: Bow Bridge which spans a neck of the Lake.
About 1895.

718240f-b.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake
718240f-b.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, a view towards Central Park West at 72nd
Street and south, showing wild ducks and geese. The bridge
spans a narrow part of the Lake in the center of it.
1923.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, another view.
1923.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A view west across the southwestern bay of the Lake, showing
some of the wild geese on the shore in the foreground.
The old Majestic Hotel and part of the Dakota apartment house
are shown in the right foreground.
1923.
P. L. Sperr.
718240f-b.folder: Central Park & The Lake, Manhattan, NY

718243f-a.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, along the northern shore, near the
Ramble. The woman in the foreground is feeding the wild geese.
1923.

(2)
Another part of the northern shore, near the Ramble, showing
some 1ittle boys fishing.
Summer, 1923.
P. L. Sperr.

718247f-b.text:
(1)
Central Park : The Lake, southwestern bay, view west towards 72nd
Street. The old Dakota apartment house is the building at the
right.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.  ,- ,r
NO REPRODUCTIONS.  N E G R112:
(2)
The same, at a small footbridge, also showing the Langhsm on
Central Park West from 73rd to 74th Streets.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A close view of the western shore at 74th Street, with the
Langham apartment house in the background. Notice the 1ittle
boy with his sailboat.
May 17, 1933.

718234f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718234f-a.text:
Central Park: The Lake, a view southeast, Showing the buildings on
and near Fifth Avenue. The tall one on the left is the Carlyle,
a forty-story apartment hotel at Madison Avenue and 76th Street.
June 24, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

Central Park: The Lake, a view west of south towards Sixth

water.
Summer, 1931.

The same, another view.

718229f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718229f-a.text:
(1)
Central Park : The Lake, view nearly due south, showing five ducks
swimming in the foreground, and the midtown skyscrapers on
the horison. The Hotel Plaza, with the Chrysler Building be-
hind it, is a little to the left of center.
May 17, 1933.
P. 1  .. Sperr.
(2)
The same, anothor view. Notice how the Empire State Building at
Fifth Avenue is hidden by the building between Essex House and
the R. C. A. Building at Radio City. A little to the left of
these, just in the center, a dirigible balloon is seen against
tho sky, probably the Goodyear blimp.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Spern.
(3)
The same, two years later. Another contrast is provided by the
fact that this third picture is an afternoon view, possibly
as late as four, which explains the blackness of the shadows
along the shore to thc right.
June 24, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
718229f-a.folder: Central Park & The Lake., Manhattan, NY

718231f-b.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718231f-b.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, a view southeast towards 60th Street.
The two apparently tallest buildings, in the center, are the
new Hotel Pierre at 6lst Street and the new Hotel Sherry-Netherland
at 59th Street and Fifth Avenue.
July 12, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A view four years later, roughly covering the left two-thirds
of No. 1. Notice the reflcction of the H'otel Pierre and the
other buildings.
June 24, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
718231f-b.folder: Central Park & The Lake., Manhattan, NY

718245f-c.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718245f-c.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, a rowboat landing platform on the north-
western shore. The view is south.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Northern part, a view south from above 'Indian Cave'.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, two years later, taken from the rock in the right fore-
ground of the 1933 view.
June 24, 1935.
L. Sperr.

718246f-c.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718246f-c.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, a view south, from the northeastern shore.
July 12, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Two years later, a view nearly the same but including a few build-
ings on Sixth Avenue and west not shown in the first view.
The new R. C. A. Builcing at Radio City, had it been built at
the time, would have been almost entire off the picture at
the right.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A similar view to No. 1, from the eastern side of the little
promontory in the foreground.
Notice the Goodyear dirigible overhead.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
718246f-c.folder: Central Park & The Lake., Manhattan, NY

718249f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718249f-a.text:
Central Park. Youthful skippsrs return to their favorite
sport again. Ihe lake in Central Park, New York, where
the youngsters are enjoying themselves this bright
spring weather.
Pictorial Press Photos, 15W. 41st St., N.Y.C.

718256f-b.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718256f-b.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, a view southeast towards the hotels at
the Plana, Fifth Avenue and 59th Street.
June 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, two years later; the camera points more towards
west than in either (1) or (3).
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as the first view, four years later, but taken from
closer to the southeastern shore, on a sunny afternoon.
June 24, 1935.
L. Sperr.
